verses.roman:
saṁvibhajyāgrato viprān
srak-tāmbūlānulepanaiḥ
suhṛdaḥ prakṛtīr dārān
upāyuṅkta tataḥ svayam

synonyms: saṁvibhajya—distributing; agrataḥ—first; viprān—to the brāhmaṇas; srak—garlands; tāmbūla—betel nut; anulepanaiḥ—and sandalwood paste; suhṛdaḥ—to His friends; prakṛtīḥ—to His ministers; dārān—to His wives; upāyuṅkta—He partook; tataḥ—then; svayam—Himself.
translation: After first distributing flower garlands, pān and sandalwood paste to the brāhmaṇas, He would give these gifts to His friends, ministers and wives, and finally He would partake of them Himself.
